title: Drawing, Designs for Pair of Stock Cabinets, 1900–05
title_raw: Designs for Pair of Stock Cabinets
medium: Pen and black ink on thin cream paper
markings: Partial watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed:
Around left image: inscribed in graphite above image: 36793[inverted "V"Y[box with dot inside]Z MU [?]; in pen and black ink throughout image, numerical notations indicating dimensions; in graphite below image, right: $30; in pen and black ink below image: STOCK CABINET / MAHOGANY & INLAY
Around right image: inscribed in graphite, upper right corner of sheet: This s double under lining / [illegible]; above center with arrow: LOCK; in pen and black ink througout, numerical notations indicating dimensions; in pen and black ink, center right of image with arrow: Two movable shelves in cupboard; in graphite, lower right of image: $40.00 / $32.00 without inlay--; in pen black ink, below image, center: Enlarged cabinet for tobacco [?] / Mahogany & Inlay
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Two identical cabinet designs, one slightly larger: small rectangular cabinet with molded front door panel and molded back and side borders, the latter having oval hole on either side for carrying; raised on 4 straight reeded legs.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Designs for Pair of Stock Cabinets, 1900–05. Pen and black ink on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-211.
